name: Discovery Bay by Rex Resorts

reviews.text: Having read some of the previous reviews of this hotel we were very pleasantly surprised. We have travelled to Barbados many times and have stayed at Coconut Creek(knocked down and turned into flats), King's Beach and Sea Breeze and this is now our new favourite that we will be returning to again(as soon as we can arrange it!). Clearly a lot of effort has gone into improving the restaurant - the food was far better than expected, but by far the best asset of this hotel is the staff. Their commitment to making sure our stay was as enjoyable as possible was done in a way that was never intrusive, just a pleasure to talk to them. The location of the hotel is excellent as it is in Holetown with all it's amenities. The other guests were all like minded people from several different countries - we made some new friends that I feel sure we will meet again at Discovery Bay. You may be wondering why this review is titled return of the monkeys, well they hadn't been seen at Discovery Bay for sometime but we were lucky enough to see 2 of them crossing the garden. All in all this was a holiday we will remember for years.
reviews.title: Return of the Monkeys

likes.liked: — Right on the beach, great staff, great food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is in a great location - very close to Holetown and only a short walk from the shops and amenities there. The hotel itself is on a very large plot, with a good amount of beach which is nice and sandy and not bad for swimming.
reviews.title: Good location, tired and dated hotel

likes.disliked: — How dated and unloved the whole resort felt

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Unfortunately, the hotel itself has seen better days - it is very tired and dated. There were plenty of staff working on maintaining the place, but they just seemed to be going about it in the wrong way - it felt like the place was getting continual coats of cheap paint to keep it patched up when what it really needs is a proper renovation. There are new looking tables in the dining room, which were nice and showed what could be done.
reviews.title: Discovery Bay - Excellent Location and Good Price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was a decent size with a reasonable balcony, but the bathroom felt very old and basic - the shower was terrible, with very little water pressure at the best of times, and on one day so little water left that you could barely get wet under it. The Air Conditioning did work, but made a loud ratting noise so you couldn't have it on while you slept. The furniture was also very dated (and was all painted with emulsion, I think so that they can regularly repaint it to keep it looking more fresh). The room had the ambience of an old style travelodge type room.
reviews.title: Genuine review from genuine experienced traveller

reviews.text: We had an all inclusive package, and regretted it - the breakfast was OK (bacon, sausage, toast, pancakes, omelettes / eggs), but was the same every day. The lunch was probably the worst - the food from the 'grill' was pretty terrible - pre-cooked hamburgers, hotdogs or chicken nuggets that were warmed up on the grill or a dish of the day that was a pot luck as to whether it was OK or not. Dinner was a mixed bag - the day they had the BBQ was good - nice steaks, chicken or fish with baked potatoes, but aside from this it was a pot luck of different types of stews that often didn't look too appealing. The fried chicken and the roasted meats (lamb or ham) was good though. I don't think the all inclusive package was great value for money as the food got very 'samey' quickly and you wanted to go to eat out elsewhere to get a change.
reviews.title: Nice relaxing holiday

likes.liked: — could swim in there pool as not crowded.
likes.disliked: — No loud music playing throughout the day round pool and beach.

reviews.text: This hotel is old and shabby and in dire need of refurbishment, but also spacious and in a great location in holetown. All the amenities, bars, restaurants etc are on the doorstep. The beach is a little bigger than most others around there too. So although we were shocked when we got there and had to re-hang the wardrobe doors - we liked it. It was all inclusive, which was basic but ok and as the restaurants outside are shockingly expensive, it worked out a good deal. They had banned children when we were there, so it was peaceful and relaxing, but i believe they have rescinded that rule.
reviews.title: Great location

likes.disliked: — condition of hotel and lack of amenities

reviews.text: Not a bad discovery.
reviews.title: not a bad discovery

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall and looking back this place was not too bad at all. We found an all inclusive offer on travelfinger.com and decided very last minute to take it. If you’re after a well priced value for money holiday that’s exactly what you’ll get and a little bit more.
reviews.title: One night only....................

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel has a quaint feel about it; it’s not really very modern and could do with some touch ups, but that’s what makes it nice in a way. Big all inclusives are starting to feel the same to me wherever I go, so it felt a bit different. Our room overlooked the gardens and it was fine, spacious and clean, though those with sea views could not wait to tell you their rooms were superb!!
reviews.title: Enjoyed Discovery Bay

likes.disliked: — Could use more activities - this seems like a simple fix, some decor needs to be updated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Transfer from the airport is about an hour and the general location of the place is good. The local village Holes Town is just up the road and there’s plenty of places to eat and drink if you get board of the hotel, all be it Barbados is not that cheap.
reviews.title: We enjoyed it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a lovely hotel, great location, on a lovely beach, near good restaurants ect- staff were friendly and really helpful, cleaners came in every day and cleaned room, changed towels, there are guards on the beach (doesn't feel like you need them) but meant we left our stuff on the beach without worrying about our cameras, ect as we swam went off for lunch. hardly any insects, (which was my main concern)- got 2 mosquitoe bites in 2 weeks, and hotel room didn't even have one ant! I would recommend getting room only instead of all inclusive as we enjoyed getting local buses, (stop is outside hotel) to some real fun funky tasty cheap places, wheras hotel food was quite expensive, and lacked the fun of an authentic experience. I would deffo go back to this hotel, its great value for money, we had a clean good sized room, massive bed, and balcony and much more and had a great holiday. (Watersports are available from a hotel 3 mins walk down the beach- its worth haggling, but we did doughnuts, kayaking, snorkelling quite cheap but discovery bay itself does not seem to provide them.)
reviews.title: Lovely jubilee

likes.disliked: — Entertainment was ok, but hotel seemed quite empty so lacked atmosphere in evenings.

reviews.text: Have just returned from a holiday here with old school friend. We visited the South Coast of Barbados last year and had a great time. Am pleased to say that this year's holiday was even better. As some travellers report there are some slightly tired features to the hotel: the odd water mark on a dining room ceiling, but nothing terrible. Our room was fresh and clean with lovely comfortable beds and nice touches like an ironing board and iron. The public rooms were newly furnished and painted, the staff were overall friendly and helpful and we found the food good. Slightly samey perhaps but well-cooked and with a good choice. Vegetarians could pick their own meal in the morning and the chef would produce dinner to their requirements.
reviews.title: Fantastic Break

likes.liked: — Lovely gardens with animals and birds, location near Holetown

reviews.text: A wonderful feature of this hotel is the size of the gardens which lead down to the beach. More modern hotels were often crammed on narrow sites between road and sea, which must have made them very noisy. We slept well and spent many happy times watching the wild life in the morning: we were lucky enough to have a tree quite close which meant we watched hummingbirds just a few feet away and a lovely monkey family taking the early morning air.
reviews.title: Completely and Utterly surprised, NOT IMPRESSED.

likes.liked: — I loved the sea view and just the way the room looked!

reviews.title: In the Pink !
reviews.text: The other guests were very friendly and we were able to share tips and experiences. There is a pre-bookable return bus to Bridgetown every morning which is free but not advertised and there are always the ear-splitting reggae buses too! If you can drage yoursef away from the beach, we recommend two wonderful museums: Arlington House in Speightstown for island history and the fantastic synagogue museum in Bridgetown. Both had state-of-the-art interractive displays and are well worth visiting.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: (I would give this hotel a 2 and 3/4) We recently went to Descovery Bay, when we entered the hotel we were unimpressed, the brosure states that the hotel has scuba diving, snorkerling ect. But in true fact it does not at all! In fact there is nothing to do in the hotel at all! if you wanted to water ski or snorkel then you'd have to go out on the beach and pay someone to
reviews.title: Great 3* All Inclusive
Disappointing
reviews.text: We have been to Barbados 5 times staying at 3 different hotels and was really disappointed with Discovery Bay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The overall atmosphere of the hotel was dull and the food was just so boring - Macaroni cheese, Spag Bol and cherry pie on 5 consecutive days, not really what you expect of the Caribbean.
reviews.title: Great location, pity about the rest

reviews.text: This is the only hotel where we have been invited to the Manager's Cocktail Party when neither the Manager nor any of his staff made themselves known.
reviews.title: Quiet Hotel, Excellent Location
Nice Old Fashioned Hotel
reviews.text: The upgrade to a beachfront room was certainly worth it for the views of some stunning sunsets but they do need some renovations. The air conditioning didn't work properly with the lowest temperture in the room being 26C.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is next door to Mango Bay and between the hotels runs a storm runoff, if you are unlucky enough to experience a bad storm, as we were, be prepared to have all the filth, muck and debris deposited in to the sea closing the beach for 3 days. No apologies or assistance from the staff with regards this and no mention in the brochures.
reviews.title: Discover Discovery Bay !

aka: Discovery Bay By Rex Hotel Saint James
